column2: Were T   alent Pooling   for an experienced   Procurement Officer - Food Specialist   to add to our growing team    As our Procurement Officer - Food Specialist, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing the procurement and sourcing of food products for our organization    You will research and evaluate suppliers, negotiate contracts, and ensure that all food purchases meet our quality and safety standards    To be successful in this role, you will need a deep understanding of food procurement processes, strong negotiation skills, international exposure and the ability to build and maintain positive relationships with suppliers    You will also work closely with other teams in our organization to ensure that our food procurement needs are met efficiently and effectively        Your key responsibilities will include:       Researching and evaluating potential suppliers of food products    Negotiating contracts and terms with suppliers to ensure favorable pricing and quality    Understand the client product specifications and standards in order to identify potential suppliers.    Locate and review vendors of assigned category products, materials, equipment, and supplies in order to determine product availability, competitive terms and conditions, and delivery schedules to deliver the best value, high-quality, compliant assigned category products.    Forecast levels of demand for products to meet the business requirements to ensure a consistent supply of products.    Managing and tracking food inventory levels and purchase orders    Collaborating with other teams in our organization to ensure food procurement needs are met    Monitoring market trends and developments to identify new opportunities and risks    Proactively work with Legal and Finance teams to ensure legally compliant supplier agreements and timely supplier payment processing    Review approved purchase requests and technical specifications and subsequently prepare a RFQ to send to approved suppliers in order to obtain competitive quotes    Track delivery of items by regularly following up with suppliers and communicate delivery date to logistics team in order to be prepared for delivery of items    Provide input during the bidding process on general procurement as and when requested in order to ensure accurate information is given    Ensuring all food purchases meet our quality, safety, and regulatory standards    Handle other procurement activities as required      Bachelors degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field    Proven work experience as a Procurement Officer, with a focus on food procurement    Strong knowledge of food procurement processes and regulations    Excellent negotiation and communication skills    Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with suppliers    Proficiency in procurement software and tools    Strong analytical and problem-solving skills    Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities    Willingness to travel as needed

column2: What this job involves:Ensuring end-to-end transport coverageAre you a stickler for getting things done in their proper order? If so, then you might just be what were looking for.Reporting to the facility manager, you??l provide efficient and cost effective transport service to the client. You??l also see to it that each vehicle leaves at the exact appointed time, and that the start time and kilometre readings are constantly logged for documentation.Likewise, you??l ensure that our staff log their boarding and initial pick up time??nd that only those listed on our roster sheet are picked up. Should the need arise, you??l also make sure that approval is on hand for staff in need of pick up.You??l also help maintain a 24/7 transport helpdesk, which will provide call logging services and handle queries and concerns. On top of these, you??l also monitor and report cases of speeding and other incidents to the Transport Helpdesk, and communicate with them over the radio when needed.Furthermore, you??l be in charge of filling our log books upon arrival to the client?? site, but leaving out any excess mileage.Serving as a go-between among teamsBeing a part of the JLL family, you??l be constantly collaborating with teams across the board??specially in this role. As the person in charge, you??l be central in supporting the transport team at the client?? facility.? You??l also be responsible for keeping in touch with our vendor supervisors.In addition, you??l keep a record of important transport-related phone numbers. Also part of your scope is to prepare work orders and assign a unique reference number for each transport request. Your superior analytical skills will also prove handy, as you??l look into and prepare daily, weekly and monthly transport reports.Sound like you? To apply you need to have:A strong drive toward excellenceWorking at JLL, you??l see yourself working with many of the industry?? premier talents and innovators. That is why you must have a laser beam focus on excellence.To land this job, you must be a graduate of any discipline with three to five years??experience in transport management in a BPO setting. You must also demonstrate an aptitude in working with a team. Furthermore, you must have a solid background in developing and monitoring improvement programs.What we can do for you:At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realise your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.Apply today!

column2: The senior-level professionals will be responsible to proactively manage high-profile international/national accounts within all the practice areas of the firm. You will be expected to develop strong client relationships, managing the day-to-day client activities and projects, and drive the public relations strategy and communications plans, working under the guidance of the Account Director.     Primary Responsibilities     Develop and cultivate relationships with the client and external audiences.    Oversee day-to-day client projects and events to ensure the quality of work meets the client s objective and in a manner that provides value.    Recommend and implement initiatives that improve the public s perception of the client.    Manage all media relations and special media inquiries.    Prepare and review materials (e.g., pitch letters, news releases, backgrounders, fact sheets, bios, and newsletters) including complex issues (e.g., QA, speeches, and collateral materials)    Develop, pitch, and place positive stories about the client in business, trade, and consumer media.    Cultivate positive client presence in media through press releases, contact, and responsiveness to inquiries/requests.    Maintain clear and consistent communication between the client and account team.    Partner with client and other communications firms (i.e., ad agencies) to develop and deliver a complete communications plan.    Research, assist and present new business proposals.    Develop original research, surveys, market studies for existing and new business proposals.    To be considered for this type of role, you will need to demonstrate strong written and verbal communications skills in ENGLISH, hands-on client relationship management, strong media relations skills, and the ability to understand a client s business. You will have worked in a PR agency, with a minimum of 3+ years experience in PR or journalism.     Desired Skills     Strong oral, writing, and editing skills in English.    Must have excellent interpersonal skills    Ability to motivate the work of account staff    Ability to handle and manage stressful situations    Ability to develop and present new business pitches    Ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously    Strong ability to develop and deliver presentations and pitches to clients    Ability to think creatively    Conversant with the principles of Perception Management    Ability to plan strategically and globally    Ability to write strategic materials for Client    Proficient in computer software

column1: Supplier Compliance and Assurance Project Manager
column2: ISS is looking for dynamic individuals in the supply chain, risk and assurance function to drive CUSTOMER VALUE by securing assurance of subcontractors that provide compliance services to ISS.            You will be responsible for supplier relationship management through remote quality assurance and performance management of key global supplier partners.            You will deliver ASSURANCE through validating service provided across the globe, reviewing performance according to the customer contracts, providing input to the contract negotiations, maintain relationship with the service provider by ensuring operational performance.            You will also drive PRODUCTIVITY efficiencies through automated review models and dashboards to deliver transparency. EVIDENCE of Supplier compliance and performance incl. active control of subcontractor deliveries.             The roles primary focus will be supplier assurance and performance management aligned to the outsourced Compliance scope of services. The role will work cross-functionally to ensure effective supplier management and strong relationships with both ISS functions and countries.                What you ll do:               Supplier Relationship Management Ensure focus with global supplier(s), that delivery is consistent, aligned to scope and quality assured.              Act as point of escalation, demonstrating global single point of contact for supplier relationship management on account(s)              Ensure suppliers are managed in accordance with ISS and Customer supplier control obligations              Project management of assurance program within ISS. This requires a hands-on delivery of strategic projects within the area of assurance to Global Key Account customers              Support strategy of global supplier assurance effort and improve KPIs such as spend under contract, spend with preferred suppliers, % of deliveries managed as per customer assurance requirements, etc.              Drive and implement industry-specific Supplier Assurance to: Analyse contracts and identify risks to develop relation specific assurance programs. Map account-specific assurance-related requirements, incl. understanding critical customer processes; Adapt and deploy group supplier management processes to other subcontractors, ensuring a close collaboration with our customers account- and site teams; Drive implementation of key strategic procurement initiatives including various supplier assurance activities such as coordinating supplier onboarding, contract SLAs, performance management, audits of suppliers, etc.              Interact with customer and internal stakeholders and deliver supplier assurance oversight and reporting across key accounts              Maintain, review and improve subcontractor performance, identify gaps and adjust against service levels, any non-performance claims are tracked and accounted              Implement ISS best practice operations within supplier relationship management and contract management              Maintain subcontractor relationship in alignment with ISS s responsible sourcing requirements and work with subcontractors to close any gaps and claims               Who you ll work with:               GKA Global Account Director / Global Ops Directors ensure in first instance Compliance Services are managed effectively.              GKA Functional Leads - Support GKA Operations & functional leads with Stakeholder engagement meetings              Supplier partner key contacts              Interact with senior ISS stakeholders in establishing a fact base for implementing and driving performance management of suppliers and subcontractors              Interact with our customers to define, deliver, and update on the assurance progress and enable a risk              Drive results through working with country procurement, operations organizations and subcontractor.               Key qualifications:               Experience with supply chain and compliance activities in supply chain environments in facility management or mechanical engineering              Experience in operational vendor / third party risk and compliance              Experience in Vendor Assurance & SLA compliance in facility management industry              Experience with working with suppliers of different size and industry.              Worked with change management and successfully navigated in a complex matrix structure with senior stakeholders.              Experience from international and multicultural global organizations.              Excellent English skills written and verbally               Personal skills you excel:               On a personal level, you are structured and demonstrates energy, persistence, and determination in the implementation of projects and initiatives.              You are diplomatic and persuasive and demonstrates good understanding of the general business principles.              Moreover, you have great interpersonal skills in building relationship and networking with both internal and external stakeholders.              Knowledge of Technical Services

column2: We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to join our Product team in India, focusing on building products, platforms, and tools that will enable effective and quality energy data to customers in a faster, secure, and reliable manner     This person will be responsible for creating and executing the product roadmap and leading product initiatives from conception to launch and subsequent iterations, by connecting customer needs, technological capabilities, and business goals   This person should have experience building platform products with significant scale and complexity and supporting both external and internal customers    This person will collaborate frequently with engineers, product designers, data science teams, other product managers locally & globally, and cross functional teams like Customer Success, Operations etc to ensure the success of their product    The ideal candidate is a self-starter, detail oriented, and an empathetic collaborator who enjoys breaking complex problems into smaller steps that drive iterative product development and who can create and execute roadmaps and can coordinate cross-department initiatives and drive them to completion     What you'll do:     Create and own the product roadmap for your charter aligning to the overall business and product strategy that helps build and scale Arcadia s cleantech products      Define, prioritize, and build product initiatives and features that improve the customer experience, quality, and reliability of the data delivery systems and applications     Champion the needs of the direct and indirect users of the products you build: Arcadia s customers and Arcadia employees      Build product experiences for multiple personas and partners, including residential and commercial customers, our support and operations teams, and our go-to-market teams     Write clear product requirements that can be easily understood by technical and non-technical audiences     Collaborate cross-functionally with peers in Engineering, Product Design, and Data Science to deliver products on time     Uncover insights from analytics, user research, and use cases that come from cross-functional partners in Customer Success, Operations, and other departments     Constantly monitor and update on the progress of the initiatives to all the relevant stakeholders and the leadership team     Balance long-term bets with short term improvements, optimizing for speed of learning and time to impact     What will help you succeed:   Must-haves:     Bachelors or Masters degree in engineering or business management from reputed universities     8+ years of overall experience in software product management in SaaS or data/platform product companies and at least 6+ years of direct & hands-on PM experience      Experience building B2B or B2C software products, ideally with notable technical complexity     Experience working with globally distributed teams in multiple timezone environments     Strong expertise with internal tools and systems in a medium to large enterprise and building complex systems around automation     Demonstrated experience aligning and influencing cross-functional teams and diverse stakeholders      Proven ability to break down complex problems into incremental product solutions      Strong organizational and project management skills, and a proactive communication style     Ability to think strategically      A growth mindset and comfort with ambiguity      Passion for our mission, sustainability, and helping drive a clean-energy future     Nice-to-haves:     Hands on experience working in squad-based agile product development model handling teams with 10+ members consisting of engineers, designers, and data analysts     Experience working in a regulated vertical (ideally energy, but if not, a background in finance, telecom, healthcare would be helpful)     At least 3+ yrs experience in mentoring junior product managers     Experience working with and supporting enterprise customers     Experience working with senior leadership in driving strategic initiatives     Experience designing and shipping APIs to support customers or internal teams     Benefits:      Competitive compensation based on market standards    We are working on a hybrid model with remote first policy     Apart from Fixed Base Salary potential candidates are eligible for following benefits     Flexible Leave Policy   Office is located in the heart of the city in case you need to step in for any purpose.   Medical Insurance (1+5 Family Members)   Annual performance cycle   Quarterly team engagement activities and rewards & recognitions   L&D programs to foster professional growth
